questions.question: Which Houthi official was confirmed killed in the Israeli airstrike on a meeting of senior Houthi officials in or near Sanaa in late August 2025?
questions.explanation: Houthi authorities confirmed that Ahmed (Ahmad) al‑Rahawi, the prime minister of the Houthi‑run government, was killed in the Israeli airstrike; Muhammad Ahmad Miftah was named to carry out the prime minister’s duties, Mahdi al‑Mashat remained a Houthi leader, and Benjamin Netanyahu is Israel's prime minister.

questions.question: Under the memorandum of understanding signed with Nauru, what was the reported initial payment Australia agreed to pay once the first group arrives?
questions.explanation: News reports state the deal includes an initial upfront payment of about A$408 million once the first group arrives. The figure of about A$70 million that appears in coverage refers to an ongoing annual/resettlement payment, not the initial payment.

questions.question: According to ABC News (29–30 Aug 2025), roughly how many SES requests for assistance did Victoria receive in the 24 hours after the late‑winter cold front on 29–30 August 2025?
questions.explanation: ABC News reported the Victorian State Emergency Service received about 1,400 requests for assistance in the past 24 hours after the storm (around 800 of those were for fallen trees).

questions.question: What time (AEST) will the opening bounce of the 2025 Toyota AFL Grand Final take place?
questions.explanation: The AFL Commission confirmed the 2025 Toyota AFL Grand Final will be played on Saturday 27 September 2025 with the opening bounce at 2:30pm AEST, retaining the traditional daytime slot. (Note: 12:30pm is the WA local time (AWST) equivalent, not AEST.)

questions.question: At his Westminster Magistrates’ Court appearance on 30 August 2025, which of the following was a bail condition imposed on Charles Nall‑Cain, 3rd Baron Brocket?

answers.text: He was granted bail with a GPS‑tag‑monitored exclusion from the M25
He was required to surrender his peerage title
He was immediately deported from the UK

questions.explanation: Contemporary reports state that at his 30 August appearance Brocket was granted bail with conditions that included a GPS‑tag‑monitored exclusion from coming within the M25. He was not remanded in custody, was not required to surrender his title, and was not deported.
